leaderUpgrades.name: Aggressive
leaderUpgrades.definition: Each turn, one unit within 12” of this unit may automatically pass an Attack or Move activation without needing to roll dice (may be used on this own unit).

leaderUpgrades.name: Psyker or Chaplain
leaderUpgrades.definition: For each HQ with this trait, you may reroll any one set of dice in its entirety, rolled by any player.

leaderUpgrades.name: Bloodthirsty
leaderUpgrades.definition: Same as the Bloodthirsty rule. Applies only to this unit and cannot be purchased if the unit already has this rule.

leaderUpgrades.name: Champion
leaderUpgrades.definition: In Challenges, this unit is only hit on a 6, and treats the opposing Leader's armor as if it was 1. If this unit isn't the Leader, it can perform Challenges anyway.

leaderUpgrades.name: Brutal
leaderUpgrades.definition: Any unit within 12" of this unit may automatically pass a failed Rally or Courage test by removing 1 Strength Point (the very real threat of enforced sacrifice really does make a warrior much bolder).

leaderUpgrades.name: Sub-Command
leaderUpgrades.definition: Each turn, you may reroll 1 additional failed Move, Attack, or Shoot activation test (no other tests) within 12" of your Leader's unit.

leaderUpgrades.name: Vexilla
leaderUpgrades.definition: This unit and units within 12" may reroll each of its Courage tests once.

leaderUpgrades.name: Drunkard or Eccentric
leaderUpgrades.definition: After deployment but before the first turn, roll to see how much this unit has drunk. On a 1-2, the HQ drank too much and cannot be ordered on the first round. On a 3-4, Attack Value is increased by 1. On a 5-6, the HQ counts as Massive.

leaderUpgrades.name: Fearless
leaderUpgrades.definition: This unit is not affected by Fearsome or Panic enemy units.

leaderUpgrades.name: Fearsome
leaderUpgrades.definition: Same as the Fearsome rule. Applies only to this unit and cannot be purchased if the unit already has this rule.

leaderUpgrades.name: Impulsive
leaderUpgrades.definition: Each turn, one unit within 12" of this unit may automatically pass a Move or Shoot activation without needing to roll dice (may be used on this own unit).

leaderUpgrades.name: Mortifactor
leaderUpgrades.definition: Vehicles within 12" of the Leader's unit always count as being in cover.

leaderUpgrades.name: Great Sub-Command
leaderUpgrades.definition: Each turn, you may reroll 2 additional failed Move, Attack, or Shoot activations tests (no other tests) within 12" of your Leader's unit.

leaderUpgrades.name: Unflinching
leaderUpgrades.definition: When required to Retreat, this unit retreats only 1".

leaderUpgrades.name: Indomitable
leaderUpgrades.definition: During Attacks, this unit may reroll up to 3 failed hit dice.

leaderUpgrades.name: Patient
leaderUpgrades.definition: Each turn, one unit within 12" of your Leader's unit may choose to ignore a Wild Charge activation (may be used on this own unit).

leaderUpgrades.name: Rash
leaderUpgrades.definition: This unit gains the Wild Charge rule. Cannot be purchased if the Leader's unit already has Wild Charge.

leaderUpgrades.name: Gun Master
leaderUpgrades.definition: Units within 12" of this unit may automatically pass a Shoot activation without needing to roll dice (may be used on this own unit).

leaderUpgrades.name: Mighty
leaderUpgrades.definition: During Attacks, this unit may reroll 2 failed hit dice.

leaderUpgrades.name: Warmaster
leaderUpgrades.definition: Ths unit automatically passes all Move, Attack and Shoot activation tests. Wild Charges, Counter-charges, and Brace are tested as normal.

leaderUpgrades.name: Quick
leaderUpgrades.definition: Increase this unit's maximum movement distance by 2".

leaderUpgrades.name: Armistus
leaderUpgrades.definition: At the start of the game, select one Upgrade from an enemy unit, which doesn't apply for this game.

leaderUpgrades.name: Siegebreaker
leaderUpgrades.definition: At the start of the game, declare 1 enemy Vehicle, Fortification, or Cumbersome unit, which has its Armor reduced by 1. Doesn't stack.

leaderUpgrades.name: Delegatus
leaderUpgrades.definition: May add or subtract 1 from your total (your choice) when rolling to decide attacker/ defender as described in Chapter 5. Doesn't stack.

factions.name: Legiones Astartes
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes companies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally their leader may take a free Legion upgrade, and all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: Questoris Knights
additionalRules: A Questoris Knights army may nominate a Vehicle as a Leader, but it cannot have Leader Traits. To compensate for this and the low unit count, you may upgrade your units with Double Time for free.

factions.name: Cult Mechanicum
additionalRules: Cult Mechanicum armies may have 1 Archmagos Prime, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally their leader may take a free Devotion upgrade.

factions.name: Talons of the Emperor
additionalRules: Talons of the Emperor companies may, once per round, automatically succeed on an Order of their choice - the Emperor's finest warriors have no time for blunders.

factions.name: Solar Auxilia
additionalRules: The leader may select a free Allegiance upgrade. Additionally, you may upgrade Vehicles to Veteran for 4 points each (8 for Superheavy Tanks), an option usually reserved for Infantry.

upgrades.name: Fearsome
upgrades.definition: Some people are just that much scarier than others, especially if in power armor and mutated! A Fearsome unit creates panic in its opponents through reputation, deed, or other psychological means. Courage tests caused as a result of this unit Attacking or Shooting suffer an additional -1 to the total. Should two Fearsome units encounter one another, the effect of this rule is cancelled between those units

upgrades.name: Heretic
upgrades.definition: Enemy units have -1 to all Courage tests. Additionally, your Leader has Panic.

upgrades.name: Heretek
upgrades.definition: Enemy Vehicles and Cumbersome units have -1 to their Armor.

upgrades.name: Fists and Claws
upgrades.definition: Infantry and HQ units (including Cumbersome) count as Armor 2 in melee against this unit. Range is reduced by 12”. Cannot be taken alongside Anti-Tank or Anti-Infantry

upgrades.name: Independent
upgrades.definition: Friendly units within 12” ignore Anti-Tank and Anti-Infantry.

upgrades.name: Imperial
upgrades.definition: Friendly vehicles within 24” of any friendly HQ model automatically succeed Order rolls.

upgrades.name: Loyalist
upgrades.definition: Friendly units within 9” of any friendly HQ model automatically succeed Order rolls.

upgrades.name: Dark Angels
upgrades.definition: Terminators, Saturnine Terminators, Outriders, and HQ models with Terminator Armor or Bikes have Bloodthirsty.

upgrades.name: Emperor's Children
upgrades.definition: Friendly units within 9” of any friendly HQ model strike first when Defending.

upgrades.name: Iron Warriors
upgrades.definition: Enemy Vehicles and Fortifications within 12” of any friendly HQ model have -1 to their Armor.

upgrades.name: White Scars
upgrades.definition: Friendly HQ models may upgrade with Relic Bikes for free.

upgrades.name: Space Wolves
upgrades.definition: Friendly units within 12” of any friendly HQ model have Counter-charge.

upgrades.name: Imperial Fists
upgrades.definition: Friendly units without Fists and Claws, Anti-Infantry or Anti-Tank gain Rapid Fire (it is assumed these units have Bolters).

upgrades.name: Night Lords
upgrades.definition: Enemy units have -1 to all Courage and Rally tests.

upgrades.name: Blood Angels
upgrades.definition: Friendly HQ, Despoiler and Assault Squad units have Counter-charge and Great Strength.

upgrades.name: Iron Hands
upgrades.definition: Friendly Vehicles and Fortifications within 9” of any friendly HQ model have +1 to their Armor.

upgrades.name: World Eaters
upgrades.definition: All friendly units have Wild Charge.

upgrades.name: Ultramarines
upgrades.definition: Once per round, you may automatically succeed an actiivation for any unit except a Vehicle.

upgrades.name: Death Guard
upgrades.definition: Friendly HQ units are unaffected by Anti-Infantry or Anti-Tank.

upgrades.name: Thousand Sons
upgrades.definition: Friendly HQ units, Tactical Squads, and Terminators may upgrade with Lesser Psyker for free.

upgrades.name: Sons of Horus
upgrades.definition: Friendly HQ, Increased Squad Size and Veteran units have Panic.

upgrades.name: Word Bearers
upgrades.definition: May take a unit of Chaos Furies for free.

upgrades.name: Salamanders
upgrades.definition: Friendly units with Anti-Infantry or Anti-Tank may reroll Shooting dice of 1.

upgrades.name: Raven Guard
upgrades.definition: Friendly HQ units, Assault Squads and Despoiler Squads have Hard to target.

upgrades.name: Alpha Legion
upgrades.definition: You may choose to not reveal your HQ's Leader Traits, but must reveal them when they are used or relevant otherwise.

upgrades.name: Bloodthirsty
upgrades.definition: A Bloodthirsty unit can inflict a whole load of additional pain on an enemy – if it rolls well. Any Attack dice or Shooting dice (but not Defence dice) that roll a 6 cause 2 hits rather than the usual 1 hit. This stacks with other rules like Great Strength and Rapid Fire.

upgrades.name: Veteran
upgrades.definition: Veteran units are tougher variations of units. These units get +1 to all order rolls, as well as to their Armor, Attack Value, Defense Value and Shooting Value. Cannot be mixed with Increased Squad Size.

upgrades.name: Javelins
upgrades.definition: Shoot 6+/Range 6” hitting on 5+

upgrades.name: Double Time
upgrades.definition: Once per game, this unit may receive two orders, instead of the usual one. You declare one order first and the other afterwards when doing this.

upgrades.name: Transport
upgrades.definition: At the start of the game, nominate one friendly Infantry unit that isn't Cumbersome to be embarked in each transport you have. Do not deploy embarked units normally. At the end of the first or second round, deploy Embarked units within 6” of their specific Transport. If the Transport is destroyed, its embarked unit deploys within 2” of the Transport's immediate location before it was destroyed.

upgrades.name: Javelins Only
upgrades.definition: Most units are armed with bows, but these are instead armed with javelins, with range reduced to 6”.

upgrades.name: Mixed Weapons
upgrades.definition: Add Shoot 6+, Range 12” hitting on 5+. Remove Defensive Formation and cannot be combined with javelins

upgrades.name: Stakes
upgrades.definition: Defense 3+/Movement 3”

upgrades.name: Lesser Psyker
upgrades.definition: Once per round, this unit may suffer 1 strength point to reroll any dice in a set of dice.

upgrades.name: Mighty Weapons
upgrades.definition: +1 to Attack Value. Remove Defensive Formation

upgrades.name: The Black Rage
upgrades.definition: Wild Charge, Counter-charge, and +1 Armor.

upgrades.name: Jump Pack
upgrades.definition: Fly and +2 Movement Distance. Cannot be combined with Terminator Armor or Bike.

upgrades.name: Bike
upgrades.definition: Cumbersome, Fast and +6 Movement Distance. Cannot be combined with Jump Pack or Terminator Armor.

upgrades.name: Relic Bike
upgrades.definition: Cumbersome, Fast, +1 Armor and +6 Movement Distance. Cannot be combined with Jump Pack, Bike or Terminator Armor.

upgrades.name: Terminator Armor
upgrades.definition: Deep Strike, Cumbersome and +1 Armor, but -2 Movement Distance. Cannot be combined with Jump Pack or Bike.

upgrades.name: Medicae
upgrades.definition: +1 Armor.

upgrades.name: Bayonet
upgrades.definition: +1 to Defence Value.

upgrades.name: Snipers
upgrades.definition: HQ units count as armor 1 against Shooting by this unit (even in cover) and the unit has +2 to its Shooting orders. Cannot be takn alongside Anti-Infantry or Anti-Tank.

upgrades.name: Increased Squad Size
upgrades.definition: +5 to Strength Points, and counts as a Massive unit when calculating attack dice. Cannot be mixed with Veteran.

upgrades.name: Massive Squads
upgrades.definition: +10 to Strength Points. Cannot be mixed with Veteran.

upgrades.name: Anti-Tank
upgrades.definition: Vehicle and Fortification units count as armor 1 against Shooting by this unit (armor 2 if in cover, or against Cumbersome units). Cannot be taken alongside Anti-Infantry.

upgrades.name: Anti-Infantry
upgrades.definition: HQ and Infantry units count as armor 2 against Shooting by this unit (isn't affected by Cover). Cannot be taken alongside Anti-Tank.

keywords.name: Wild Charge
keywords.definition: If an enemy unit is within this unit’s Attack range during the ‘Activate Wild Charges’ phase, you must test to activate an Attack against it. If the test is unsuccessful, the unit remains stationary but may test for an ordered Move activation later in your turn (no other actions are allowed). Wild Charge may not be used if the unit is Battered.

keywords.name: Counter-charge
keywords.definition: When an enemy has successfully rolled to Attack this unit, but before it moves, this unit may test for a Counter-charge. Test for an Attack at 7+. If it succeeds, the two units meet a proportionate movement distance between their start positions, and both count as Attacking. If it fails, it stands in place for the enemy’s charge. Counter-charge may not be used if the unit is Battered.

keywords.name: Counter-charge vs Infantry
keywords.definition: When an enemy has successfully rolled to Attack this unit, but before it moves, this unit may test for a Counter-charge. Test for an Attack at 7+. If it succeeds, the two units meet a proportionate movement distance between their start positions, and both count as Attacking. If it fails, it stands in place for the enemy’s charge. Counter-charge may not be used if the unit is Battered.

keywords.name: Deep Strike
keywords.definition: At deployment, this unit is held in reserve. At the start of the first or second round, place this unit anywhere on the table, but no closer than 6” from any enemy models.

keywords.name: Fly
keywords.definition: This unit ignores all benefits and downsides of all terrain, but may not end in terrain that is impassable.

keywords.name: Go Back to your Farms
keywords.definition: You may select no more than 3 Levied Infantry units in a 24-point Company (scale up or down proportionately for Companys of different points values).

keywords.name: Fast
keywords.definition: This unit does not halve its movement in rough terrain.

keywords.name: Bombardment
keywords.definition: At the start of the first round, may Shoot without rolling for orders. This doesn't count as an activtion and as such it may shoot twice on the first round - once from bombardment, the other from actiivation.

keywords.name: Cumbersome
keywords.definition: Cannot embark on Transports or benefit from cover.

keywords.name: Brace
keywords.definition: When an enemy has successfully rolled to Attack this unit, but before it moves, this unit may test to Brace at 6+. If it succeeds, it immediately carries out a Skirmish action targeting the Attacking unit, may not move closer to the Attacking unit, and must avoid other units by 3” as usual. Any casualties inflicted by the Skirmish action cause a Courage test only at the end of the Attack. The charging unit then moves its full charge distance following the Bracing unit. If it makes contact it Attacks with the Bracing unit reducing its armor by 1, and if it cannot contact it must move as close as possible (moving no closer than 3” to the Bracing unit). If the Brace test fails, the unit stands in place and awaits attack without Shooting or Moving. A Bracing unit will always fight when contacted, and a unit may Brace as many times as it wishes in a turn. Brace cannot be used if the unit is Battered

keywords.name: Skirmish
keywords.definition: As an ordered activation, successful on a 7+, the unit may make a half Move and Shoot (in either order). All models in the unit Shoot with -1 to their dice scores.

keywords.name: Hard to target
keywords.definition: This unit counts as having +1 armor versus Shooting and may only be targeted within 12”.

keywords.name: Selfsufficent
keywords.definition: This unit may receive orders even if you failed an order this turn.

keywords.name: Great Strength
keywords.definition: Any Attack dice or Defence dice that roll a 6 cause 2 hits rather than the usual 1 hit.

keywords.name: Rapid Fire
keywords.definition: Any Shooting dice that roll a 6 cause 2 hits rather than the usual 1 hit.

keywords.name: Panic
keywords.definition: When this unit Shoots, the target unit must take a Courage test regardless of the number of hits inflicted.
